Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order
Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order

result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew M Galvin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Andrew M Galvin is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Andrew M Galvin was found guilty of Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).
  • Andrew M Galvin was found guilty of Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).
  • Andrew M Galvin was found guilty of Strangulation and Suffocation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order

miscConds.notes:
Total restitution amount and surcharges paid in full out of bail.  Restitution ordered for $100.00 for locks and $377.43 Dr. Visit.  Court does not order $250.00 for cell phone, parties may request a restitution hearing on that.

The restitution amount listed reflects an additional Administrative Cost of 10% of the amount of restitution pursuant to Section 973.06(1)(g).  The 5% Restitution Surcharge is equal to 5% of the total of the restitution, costs, attorney fees, and fines, pursuant to Section 973.20(11)(a).
Cts 3-5:  Total court costs paid in full out of bail.

No contact with Nicole Galvin.
Any counseling/treatment deemed appropriate.
Pay supervision fees.

timeConds.notes:
Court stays condition time.  Court will review in 1 year.

9/28/2015 -Court held review hearing on 120 days condition time. Court will permanently stay jail term.
To be determined and supervised by the Department.

Defendant Andrew M Galvin in court with attorney Mark A Langholz.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Court examines defendant, accepts waiver and binds case over for trial. State files information. Defense waives reading and enters not guilty plea. Atty. Langholz motion to amend bail conditions. Court amends bail conditions to allow defendant to pick up personal belongings from home on 5/15/2014 between 1-5 pm. Victim will not be present.

Branch 1 hearing for Branch 2 for bail purposes. Defendant Andrew M Galvin in court with attorney Mark A Langholz.  Defendant in custody. Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court is informed Branch 2 will recuse himself as Levy & Levy represent defendant. Defendant advised of complaint and penalties thereof. Court sets bail at $2000 cash with condition no contact with N.G., her residence or the street her house is located. Transfer of children shall be done by the grandparents. Atty. Langholz waives timelimits. Case to be forwarded for reassignment.
